definition: to forage/to hunt for food/to scavenge/fig. to make a living

sentences.english: Birds that overwinter in your garden need to find food 365 days of the year.
sentences.chinese: 在你的院子中過冬的鳥類一年365天都需要覓食。

sentences.english: But the mugger is back on the prowl.
sentences.chinese: 可是現在這條巨鱷又重新回來覓食了。

sentences.english: A dugong forages in the seagrass meadows of Shark Bay, Western Australia.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲在西澳洲鯊魚灣的海草中覓食的儒艮。

sentences.english: Many birds are happy to feed on the ground, eliminating the need for any feeder at all.
sentences.chinese: 很多鳥樂於在地上覓食，完全省了任何飼餌臺。

sentences.english: Chia-chu continued on his way, peering right and left as he went like a hungry stray dog on the prowl.
sentences.chinese: 曾家駒一面走，一面像覓食的野狗似的向左邊右邊看。

sentences.english: Wolves prowled the forest in search of prey .
One day, we had an argument about the hunting habits of lions and cougars .
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我們倆爲獅子和豹的覓食習性爭論起來。

sentences.english: The old matriarchs make decisions on a daily basis as to where the herd will forage or move.
sentences.chinese: 年長的首領每天決定象羣覓食或移動的地點。

sentences.english: Theater students reading a script are oblivious to a mangy dog searching for his dinner.
sentences.chinese: 同學研讀劇本，癩痢狗穿梭覓食，互不干擾。

sentences.english: rests in his beauty on the water, and the great heron feeds.
sentences.chinese: 美麗的野鴨在湖中安憩，巨大的鷺鷥在覓食。

sentences.english: Many wild creature prowl at night easysting to event to eat.
sentences.chinese: 許多野獸在夜間巡行覓食。

sentences.english: His parents worked hard bringing food to the nest, feeding him from their beaks.
sentences.chinese: 父母辛勤覓食回巢，以嘴銜食餵它。

sentences.english: Birds and wildlife need trees for food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 鳥類和野生動物需要樹木，作爲覓食和棲身之地。

sentences.english: Our cats go on the prowl at night, and then they sleep here all day.
sentences.chinese: 我們家的貓晚上悄悄出去覓食，白天就在這裏睡大覺。

sentences.english: The rate of interactions with patrollers determine whether foragers leave the nest.
sentences.chinese: 與巡邏螞蟻互動的比率決定覓食螞蟻是否離巢。

sentences.english: The python loves water, swimming or lying in it to rest or to hunt.
sentences.chinese: 南非蟒習水，喜歡在水中游動覓食或靜臥於水中休息。

definition: to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
(of a bird) to perch/(of creatures in general) to inhabit/to dwell
to walk around/to move about/to stretch one's legs/to go for a walk/to be mobile (e.g. after an illness)/to visit one another/to pay a visit (go to the toilet)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
Shulin city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
